article.headline: Stocks open higher on stimulus optimism
article.body: U.S. stocks rose at the open Thursday as investors weighed the prospects for fiscal stimulus and a more certain election outcome. The Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% gained 96 points, 0.3%, to open near 28,400, while the S&P 500 SPX, +0.87% was up 16 points or 0.5%, near 3,435. The Nasdaq Composite COMP, +1.39% added 77 points, 0.7%, and was trading near 11,442. Investment bank Morgan Stanley MS, -0.34% announced Thursday morning that it would acquire Eaton Vance Corp., EV, -0.56% a Boston-based asset manager, in a cash-and-stock deal worth approximately $56.50 a share to Eaton Vance shareholders. Eaton Vance shares surged nearly 50%, to $60.11, after the bell. First-time applications for jobless benefits fell in the most recent week, the Labor Department said Thursday morning, but at a slower pace than in previous weeks, suggesting the economic rebound may be losing momentum.
